data.title: Top Media Outlets in South Carolina
data.meta_description: What are the top media outlets in South Carolina? Read on for the top newspapers, TV, and radio stations in the Palmetto State.
data.text:
For small and midsize businesses in South Carolina, securing earned media mentions in popular local outlets is an excellent way to build brand awareness, increase exposure, solidify a positive reputation, and much more.

Landing earned media mentions starts with strategic targeting.

Here’s a list of the top media outlets in South Carolina.

Top Newspapers in South Carolina

The Post and Courier (Charleston)

Asheville Citizen-Time (Asheville)

The Sun News (Myrtle Beach)

The State (Columbia)

Greenville News (Greenville)

The Morning News (Florence)

The Herald (Rock Hill)

The Island Packet (Hilton Head)

Now that you have a list of the top media outlets in South Carolina, what’s your next move?

The next step in the earned media process is putting this information to work.

To do so, you’ll need to dig a bit deeper to pinpoint the people behind the publication.

Who writes about your industry? What’s their contact information?

These seem like basic questions but uncovering these details can be difficult and this is where a media database can help.

What’s a Media Database?

A media database is a directory that consists of the contact information of individual members of the press.

These contacts can include journalists, producers, editors, reporters, social media influencers, bloggers, and many other titles.

Typically, these databases will include relevant email addresses, phone numbers, social media handles, and any other contact information that can be used to engage individual members of the media.

Your Opportunities, Our Data

Our Media Database empowers our clients to target and pitch the right journalists to make a bigger impact with their next press release and PR campaign.

A subscription to our Media Database provides access to a comprehensive repository of 800,000 media contacts that are updated in real-time through a blend of technology and human-centered review.

In our Media Database, users are able to refine their searches with filters that include:

Beats will cover the industry you are trying to target.

Media Types include journals, newspapers, TV, magazines, blogs, radio, and more.

Role covers the person’s duty at the outlet. This could be a journalist, reporter, editor, and more.

Coverage will allow you to select what type of media you’d like to look for including local, national, international, or regional.

Location allows you to select the geographical areas you’d like to focus on.

Personalization is the first step in empowering the Media Advantage which is greater brand awareness through earned media, increased online visibility through greater SEO recognition, and more sales inquiries through targeted digital marketing campaigns.
